senses.de: To think carefully about something, usually before making a decision
senses.ex: You should consider the consequences before making a decision

Tips.title: Prior Consideration
Tips.description: Use 'consider' when you need time to think before deciding.
Tips.example: Let's consider all our options first.

Tips.title: Weighing Choices
Tips.example: I will consider your advice while making my choice.

senses.de: To regard or view in a certain way

Tips.title: Subjective View
Tips.description: 'Consider' can express a personal opinion or viewpoint.

Tips.title: Matter of Perspective
Tips.description: When using 'consider' in this sense, it’s subjective and can vary from person to person.
Tips.example: You may consider the task easy, but others find it hard.

senses.de: To take something into account when making plans or decisions
senses.ex: We'll need to consider our budget when planning the event

Tips.title: Planning Ahead
Tips.description: Use 'consider' when factors affect future plans or decisions.
Tips.example: Consider the weather when packing for your trip.

Tips.title: Informed Decisions
Tips.description: 'Consider' implies looking at all aspects to make a well-informed decision.
Tips.example: Consider both the pros and cons carefully.

senses.de: To think about and discuss something before reaching a conclusion
senses.ex: The jury is still considering the evidence

Tips.title: Legal Decisions
Tips.description: In a legal context, 'consider' means to deliberate on evidence before a conclusion.
Tips.example: The judges will consider the new testimony.

Tips.title: Discuss First
Tips.description: Before agreeing to a proposal, 'consider' signals the need for a discussion.
Tips.example: We should consider his offer before responding.

Assess.wordDefinition:
Assess means to evaluate or measure something to determine its value or quality. It's often used in more technical or formal settings like when someone is grading your performance or when a doctor is examining your health.

Assess is objective and based on data or evidence, while consider is more subjective and involves weighing options or perspectives.

Contemplate.wordDefinition:
Both consider and contemplate mean to think about something, but consider is used when you are thinking about something seriously and trying to make a decision, while contemplate is used when you are trying to understand something deeper or when you are reflecting on something.

For example, you might consider which college to attend, but you might contemplate the meaning of life.

Deliberate.wordDefinition:
Deliberate means to think about something very carefully and slowly, making sure that you are considering all possible options and outcomes.

However, consider is used when you are thinking about a decision, while deliberate is used when you are thinking about a decision very deeply and slowly.

Examine.wordDefinition:
Both consider and examine mean to think about something carefully, but consider implies more of a general contemplation or evaluation, while examine indicates a more detailed inspection or analysis.

For example, you might consider which college to attend, weighing factors such as location, reputation, and cost. You might examine a specimen in a science lab, looking closely at its physical characteristics under a microscope.

Consider is used for more abstract or conceptual things, while examine is used for more concrete or tangible things that can be inspected or studied in detail.

Ponder.wordDefinition:
Both consider and ponder are verbs that are used to describe the act of thinking about something carefully.

Ponder suggests a deeper, more contemplative kind of thinking. It means to think deeply about something, often with a sense of wonder or awe.

For example, you might ponder the mysteries of the universe or the meaning of life.

In summary, both words involve careful thought, but consider tends to imply a more practical, decision-making process, while ponder suggests a more philosophical, reflective type of thinking.

Reflect.wordDefinition:
Reflect means to think deeply about something and to try and understand it from different perspectives. It is applicable when you need to analyze your own thoughts and feelings, or to gain insight into the actions or motivations of others.

In essence, consider is more about making a decision, while reflect is more about gaining understanding.

Scrutinize.wordDefinition:
Scrutinize means to examine something closely or to inspect it thoroughly. For example, if you are scrutinizing a document, you might be looking for errors or discrepancies.

Consider is used when you are weighing different options or perspectives, while scrutinize is used when you are examining something in detail or looking for specific information.

Weigh.wordDefinition:
Weigh means to carefully evaluate and compare the different factors or options involved in a decision. It involves determining the pros and cons of each option and deciding which one has more benefits or advantages.

For example, if you are trying to decide whether or not to take a new job, you would weigh the benefits like salary and career growth opportunities against the factors like work-life balance and commute time.

In summary, 'considering' is when you think about something to form an opinion or make a decision, while 'weighing' involves evaluating and comparing the different factors or options involved in a decision.

quotes.Text: Throughout my career, I have faced the best forward players in the world - many of them who are considered among the greatest ever. For me, there is never a fear. A respect, yes, but never a fear.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Sergio Ramos

quotes.Text: I'm considered wise, and sometimes I see myself as knowing. Most of the time, I see myself as wanting to know. And I see myself as a very interested person. I've never been bored in my life.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Maya Angelou

quotes.Text: If you have three people in your life that you can trust, you can consider yourself the luckiest person in the whole world.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Selena Gomez

quotes.Text: I don't consider the first-world concerns any less important than the third-world ones.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Susan Minot

quotes.Text: I myself consider myself the most powerful figure in the world.
quotes.Title: Statesman
quotes.Name: Idi Amin

quotes.Text: I consider myself really lucky to have had such a good life.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Nyjah Huston

quotes.Text: My deepest respect to the clubs who considered having me.
quotes.Title: French Athlete
quotes.Name: Paul Pogba

quotes.Text: I consider myself a free man and a citizen of the world.
quotes.Title: French Actor
quotes.Name: Gerard Depardieu

quotes.Text: I've always considered myself a character actor.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Jack Huston

quotes.Text: I consider myself a legal citizen of the world.
quotes.Title: Russian Businessman
quotes.Name: Pavel Durov
